medical_history.chief_complaint: Patient presents after a mechanical fall at home with tachycardia and hypotension.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began following a mechanical fall in the morning. Patient was unable to get up and found on the floor at approximately 5 PM. Denies syncope or loss of consciousness but was sleepy on arrival to MICU. Initially, heart rate was 160; received IV adenosine with transient improvement but had intolerance to esmolol due to hypotension.
medical_history.past_medical_history: AVNRT, atrial fibrillation, status post pacemaker, congestive heart failure, hypertension, myasthenia gravis, tachy-brady syndrome, C. difficile colitis, upper GI bleed (gastric antral ulcer), MRSA bacteremia, fibromyalgia, benign prostatic hyperplasia, glaucoma, history of multiple episodes of syncope.
medical_history.family_history: History of cardiovascular disease in both parents. Father passed away in his 60s, mother in her 70s. Sister has diabetes.
